Title.evidence: This parallel multicentre RCT investigated the use of Fluobeam ® LX to visualize the parathyroid glands by autofluorescence during total thyroidectomy compared with no use.

Trial_Design.evidence: Patients were randomized 1 : 1 and were blinded to the group allocation.

Intervention.evidence: investigated the use of Fluobeam ® LX to visualize the parathyroid glands by autofluorescence during total thyroidectomy compared with no use.

Objective.evidence: The hypothesis was that autofluorescence enables identification and protection of the parathyroid glands during thyroidectomy.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoint was the rate of low parathyroid hormone (PTH) levels the day after surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Patients were randomized 1 : 1 and were blinded to the group allocation.

Blinding.evidence: Patients were randomized 1 : 1 and were blinded to the group allocation.

Number_Analysed.evidence: 486 patients received an intervention according to the study protocol, 246 in the Fluobeam ® LX group and 240 in the control group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: 64 patients (26.0 per cent) in the Fluobeam ® LX group and 77 (32.1 per cent) in the control group had low levels of PTH after thyroidectomy ( P = 0.141; relative risk (RR) 0.81, 95 per cent c.i. 0.61 to 1.07).

Harms.evidence: No specific harm related to the use of Fluobeam ® LX was reported.
